page.title: 01Whittington Village Profile
page.content: {Whittington}is a village with a population of 3000 situated on the A5 road 16 miles N.W. of{Shrewsbury.}To the visitor,the main feature is a ruined{Norman Castle}flanked by three pools which are all that remains of the original moat.Mallard have been introduced and now there are over 80 duck.There is a car park and a children's playground for visitors as well as the Castle Tearooms and Gallery.Opposite the Castle is the {Parish Church}of{St.John the Baptist which has a peal of six bells in its red brick,eighteenth century tower.On the edge of the village is the Whittington Cricket Club ground.The Boote,the White Lion and the Penrhos Arms are the village inns.There are three general stores,a butcher's,a post office and two antique shops.
